SEARCH
Package dataStructure.graph.adjacencyListGraph

Class AdjacencyListGraph<V>

java.lang.Object
dataStructure.graph.adjacencyListGraph.AdjacencyListGraph<V>
Type Parameters:
V - the type of vertices in the graph
All Implemented Interfaces:
Graph<V>
public class AdjacencyListGraph<V> extends Object implements Graph<V>
A class that implements the Graph interface using an adjacency list to represent the graph.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    AdjacencyListGraph()
    Constructs an empty graph.

    List<Pair<V,Route<V>>>
    bfs(V source)
    Performs Breadth First Search (BFS) algorithm on the graph, starting from the specified source vertex, to calculate the shortest path distances from the source vertex to all other vertices in the graph.

    Returns the adjacency list of the graph, which represents the relationships between nodes and their edges.

      public void addEdge(V source, V destination, Integer weight)
      Adds an edge between two vertices with the specified weight. If the vertices do not already exist in the graph, they are added.
      Specified by:
      addEdge in interface Graph<V>
      Parameters:
      source - the source vertex of the edge
      destination - the destination vertex of the edge
      weight - the weight of the edge
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if either the source or destination vertex is not found in the graph

    • shortestPath

      public Route<V> shortestPath(V source, V destination)
      Returns the shortest path between the specified source and destination vertices using Breadth First Search (BFS) algorithm. If there is no path between the source and destination, it will print a message to the console.
      Specified by:
      shortestPath in interface Graph<V>
      Parameters:
      source - the starting vertex of the path
      destination - the destination vertex of the path
      Returns:
      a Route object representing the shortest path from the source to the destination, or null if no path was found

    • bfs

      public List<Pair<V,Route<V>>> bfs(V source)
      Performs Breadth First Search (BFS) algorithm on the graph, starting from the specified source vertex, to calculate the shortest path distances from the source vertex to all other vertices in the graph. The method returns a list of pairs where the first element of each pair is a vertex in the graph, and the second element is a Route object representing the shortest path from the source vertex to that vertex.
      Parameters:
      source - the starting vertex for the BFS algorithm
      Returns:
      a list of pairs, where the first element is a vertex in the graph, and the second element is a Route object representing the shortest path from the source vertex to that vertex
